resources.string: Save default QR Code to gallery

Make sure you have prepared a QR Code that has been set to turn off the alarm (either you save it on another device or you print it)\n\nIf you haven\'t set a QR Code or you lost your QR Code, please set it again
Do you have the QR Code?

You woke up on time
Now is time for you to do your daily activities

Good luck and have a nice day :)
Scan to add custom QR Code
New code to dismiss alarm added:
Default code to dismiss alarm added:
QR code successfully added to Your gallery, now go and put it somewhere!
Failed to save the QR code to gallery…
On Android 11 and 12 this function is temporarily unavailable. Please scan Your own QR code…
Shake the device to turn off the alarm\n\n

“ASQAS” is a unique alarm application. This app is designed to help you wake up on time in an interesting way, which is by scanning the QR code and shaking your phone to turn off the alarm.\n\nHowever, not just any QR Code will do! Before setting up your first alarm, you should download the default Code Image from the Settings. If you already have your own QR Code, you can scan it - ASQAS will remember it and use it to cancel your alarm!

Unfortunately many smartphone manufacturers prefer longer battery life (even if barely noticeable) over properly working applications! Samsung, OnePlus, Huawei, Xiaomi and many others tend to be killing applications while they are working in the background.

ASQAS can also suffer this problem! Many smartphone manufacturers kill the app completely along with the alarm that was set via the ASQAS application.

In order to fix this issue, please, go to dontkillmyapp.com and follow the instructions for Your smartphone - this should help mitigate the “optimizations” carried out by Your operating system.

It looks like your QR code was lost or damaged so the scanner misread your QR code

That's okay, you can re-prepare your QR code for the next alarm

Still, good luck and have a nice day :)
